intro: Sitanion villosum, commonly known as the hairy sitanion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Sitanion villosum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
